com.googlecode.aluminumproject.cli.commands.alu

Class Alu

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.cli.Command
      • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.cli.commands.alu.Alu

  • public class Alu
extends Command
    Processes a template.

    The alu command accepts the following options:

    • The parser option (-p or --parser): which parser to use; the name of the parser is expected as an argument to the option and defaults to "aluscript".
    The name of the template has to be given as a parameter to the command. A list that contains the other arguments (if any) are made available as a context variable named "arguments".

    The template engine will use a default configuration with configuration parameters which make sure that it's template finder will be created by a file system template finder that looks for templates in the current directory and the templates directory inside the directory in which Aluminum was installed. Other configuration parameters may be specified in a properties file named alu.properties, located in ~/.aluminum, where ~ stands for the user's home directory.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ARGUMENTS_VARIABLE_NAME
      The name of the context variable that will contain any command line arguments after the first one (which is the name of the template to process): "arguments".
      static String DEFAULT_PARSER_NAME
      The name of the parser that will be used when none is specified: "aluscript".

        The name of the command;
        description
        A description of the command;
        usage
        A description of how the command can be used.
